# Request for Proposal (RFP) for Design Build Services in Sherbrooke, Quebec

## Project Description

Defence Construction Canada (DCC) is seeking proposals from design-build teams for the provision of design and construction services for the design and renovation of two armouries, as well as the construction of at least one new facility, located in Sherbrooke, Quebec.

## Objectives and Scope of Work

The selected design-build team will be responsible for the design, renovation, and construction of the above-mentioned facilities. The scope of work will include, but not be limited to, the following:

* Design and renovation of two armouries
* Construction of at least one new facility

## Tender Information

* **Reference Number**: MX-42836306561
* **Amendment Number**: 5
* **Solicitation Number**: HQ001833_80765
* **Publication Date**: 2023-08-14
* **Tender Closing Date**: 2023-10-19T14:00:00
* **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2025-04-02
* **Expected Contract End Date**: 2025-04-02
* **Tender Status**: Expired

## Project Budget and Requirements

The estimated construction cost of this project is in the order of $220,000,000. The project is subject to various government regulations and requirements, including industrial security controls.

## Selection Criteria

The selection criteria for this RFP will be based on the established evaluation criteria outlined in the RFP documents. DCC will evaluate the proposals based on the qualifications, expertise, and experience of the design-build team.

## How to Submit Your Proposal

Prospective bidders are invited to submit their proposals electronically through the MERX Electronic Bidding System by the closing date and time indicated. For more information and to access the documents, please visit http://www.merx.com.

## Important Notes

* Fees may apply for accessing the documents.
* The RFP documents and other information are available on the MERX website.
* DCC is committed to ensuring that all proponents have an equal opportunity to participate in this procurement process and are encouraged to review the JAM and JSOP documents carefully. By submitting a proposal, proponents acknowledge that they are aware of and have agreed to conform with DCC procurement policies and procedures.
